original_title: Comprehensive investigation on deaths caused by anaesthetic drug: Minister
original_body_lines: A comprehensive investigation has been launched into the deaths caused by an anaesthetic drug administered at the Peradeniya Teaching Hospital, Health Minister Keheliya Rambukwella said today.
He told Parliament that the relevant doctors have been summoned to the Health Ministry today regarding the matter.

Responding to a question by Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa regarding the deaths of two children at the Peradeniya Hospital due to the use of an anaesthetic drug, the Minister said the deaths that had occurred at the Peradeniya Children's Hospital were not due to the particular anaesthetic drug.
He said the particular anaesthetic drug is not administered to children at all and added that a separate investigation needs to be done to ascertain what had caused the children's deaths.
The Minister said such deaths have been reported only at the Peradeniya Teaching Hospital and Peradeniya Children's Hospital and nowhere else.(Ajith Siriwardana and Yohan Perera)
